definitions.definition: To inhale and exhale the smoke from a burning cigarette , cigar , pipe , etc.
examples: Smoking a pipe has gone out of fashion.
Olivia's dad smoked various brands when he was younger.

definitions.definition: To inhale and exhale tobacco smoke .

examples: My old truck was still smoking even after the repairs.

subdefinitions.definition: Of a fire in a fireplace : to emit smoke outward instead of up the chimney, owing to imperfect draught.

definitions.definition: To preserve or prepare (food) for consumption by treating with smoke.
examples: You'll need to smoke the meat for several hours.

definitions.definition: To dry or medicate by smoke .
To fill or scent with smoke ; hence, to fill with incense ; to perfume .
To perform (e.g. music) energetically or skillfully .
examples: The horn section was really smokin' on that last tune.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , slang , chiefly as present participle

definitions.definition: To kill , especially with a gun .
examples: He got smoked by the mob.

definitions.definition: To smell out; to hunt out; to find out; to detect .
To ridicule to the face ; to mock .
To burn; to be kindled; to rage.
To raise a dust or smoke by rapid motion.
To suffer severely ; to be punished .
To punish (a person) for a minor offense by excessive physical exercise.
To cover (a key blank ) with soot or carbon to aid in seeing the marks made by impressioning .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To inhale and exhale the smoke from a burning cigarette , cigar , pipe , etc.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To inhale and exhale tobacco smoke .
( transitive ) To preserve or prepare (food) for consumption by treating with smoke.
( transitive ) To dry or medicate by smoke .
( transitive , obsolete ) To fill or scent with smoke ; hence, to fill with incense ; to perfume .
( transitive , obsolete ) To make unclear or blurry .
( intransitive , slang , chiefly as present participle ) To perform (e.g. music) energetically or skillfully .
( slang ) To beat someone at something.
( transitive , slang ) To kill , especially with a gun .
( transitive , slang , obsolete ) To thrash ; to beat .
( obsolete , transitive ) To smell out; to hunt out; to find out; to detect .
( slang , obsolete , transitive ) To ridicule to the face ; to mock .
To burn; to be kindled; to rage.
To raise a dust or smoke by rapid motion.
To suffer severely ; to be punished .
( transitive , US military slang ) To punish (a person) for a minor offense by excessive physical exercise.
( transitive ) To cover (a key blank ) with soot or carbon to aid in seeing the marks made by impressioning .
